alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:14PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New Hampshire, including the following county, Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding will continue with homes potentially being impacted along route 103 along the Sugar River in Claremont. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM EST, Depending on ice behavior, any release of the jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. - A location that will experience flooding includes... Claremont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Forecast values represent ice-free flow.
